file_content.text: The Tion Hegemony will be a valuable ally against the Empire.
Just read the reports from Ord Mantell. We knew Lorrick was dangerous. Didn't realize he was a complete wack-job.
It's too bad he took his assistants down with him. Seems like they were actually working on a cure.
They tried to stop him. They destroyed his research so nobody else could use it, even though it cost them their lives.
They were heroes.
I'll see if we can get something to honor their memories. Maybe official Senate recognition of their sacrifice.
They were working with a deadly virus in a secret lab with no regard for galactic law. No surprise it ended like this.
Their research was illegal.
True enough, I suppose. Still don't think they deserved what happened to them.
The ruling family in the Tion Hegemony wanted to express their thanks as well. They appreciate the Republic's help.
It would have been handy to have a bioweapon like that in our arsenal.
Wish we'd saved the virus.
The Republic would never use something that horrific. Not even on the Empire!
And what would the Tion Hegemony think if they found out we'd seized control of the weapon that wiped out five of their worlds?
Securing an alliance with them was an important strategic victory. Now the Empire can't use their support to rebuild.
Our enemy is weaker than they've ever been. Now's our chance to finish them off.
The Empire's collapsing.
Might be a good time to press your advantage. Maybe take the Empire out once and for all.
The Empire's collapsing.
I wouldn't underestimate them. We've got the upper hand, but they always seem to find a way to claw their way back.
If we're lucky, we'll get a few generations of peace before we have to deal with them again.
The galaxy has no shortage of despots and tyrants who'll throw their lot in with the Empire.
They'll find someone else.
That's why we have people like you on our side. Hope you weren't thinking about retirement.
Guess my work here is done.
I think you've done more than anyone has a right to expect.
You probably get tired of hearing this, but I'll say it again anyway: The Republic owes you. Thanks.
The shuttle will take you to Lorrick's island on Ord Mantell whenever you're ready.
Doctor Lorrick is brilliant, arrogant, ambitious and completely amoral.
He fled the Tion Hegemony decades ago after being declared a traitor. Been hiding out on Ord Mantell ever since.
Do we know if he had any help from anyone? Like maybe the Empire?
Is he working alone?
As far as we can tell, he's acting alone. But that doesn't make him any less dangerous.
Order the authorities on Ord Mantell to take him into custody.
We should arrest him.
No. We think it's better if this gets handled outside official channels. We don't want to cause a panic.
So all this time he's been waiting to strike back at the Tion royal family.
Planning his revenge.
His ambitions go way beyond claiming the Tion Hegemony. Kaon and the other infected worlds were just a test.
Lorrick created a new strain of the rakghoul virus. One that infects any living organism.
The virus doesn't just turn the infected victims into mindless brutes, either. I saw them using blasters and other advanced technology.
It's worse than that.
Rakghouls running wild are bad enough. A rakghoul army under a madman's control would be unstoppable.
We had no idea he was working on this. The attack on Kaon tipped us off to his plans.
Why risk revealing himself?
He didn't think we'd find out. He wasn't counting on you, and he never imagined that pilot would survive the initial attack.
Any idea what he's up to now?
What's his next move?
We were able to suppress reports of what happened on Kaon. Lorrick doesn't know we're on to him.
If we strike at his base now, we'll catch him off guard. Put an end to his experiments before he unleashes another outbreak on the galaxy.
I assume taking Lorrick out will strengthen our ties with the Tion royal family?
The hegemony will be pleased.
It can't hurt. And we could always use another ally against the Emperor.
Just tell me what to do.
Simplicity will serve us best in this case. Hit fast, hit hard.
I'll leave now.
The shuttle will take you to Lorrick's island base on Ord Mantell. Do whatever it takes to stop him and his experiments.
Officially, the only occupants are him and a few lab assistants. Unofficially, expect a host of mutated guardians around every corner.
Nice job down there on Kaon. I sent a full report on what you learned to the Tion royal family.
Now that we know how the plague is spread, they've been able to contain further outbreaks.
Lucky you ran into that pilot on Kaon. What she told you helped us put together a file on Doctor Lorrick.
The pilot's dead. Doctor Lorrick couldn't have done this without help. She had to pay for her part.
It wasn't lucky for her.
I guess it was your call to make. Anyway, we need to focus on Lorrick now.
Since Ord Mantell is in Republic space, they agreed to leave Doctor Lorrick to us. I've had my agents put together a file on him.
Millions of innocent lives were lost because of his actions. I will bring him to justice.
He must pay for his crimes.
Looking into the mind of a monster is never pleasant.
A disturbing task, no doubt.
True, but sometimes we have to do things we'd rather not.
Killing soldiers on the battlefield is one thing. Slaughtering millions of innocent civilians is different.
Terrorists deserve no mercy.
The galaxy will be a better place without him.
I'll give you the short version. Doctor Lorrick--a few thrusters short of a hyperdrive.
Bet I can guess what it says.
There's no doubt he's a complete sociopath. But we've gone into a little more detail.
What's happening with Melarra?
What about the pilot I saved?
We let her go. She wasn't infected with the rakghoul virus. And any crimes she committed were outside Republic jurisdiction.
She gave us a lot of useful information on Doctor Lorrick. After that, we let her go.
We did as instructed and dropped her off on one of the nearby worlds. She's on her own now.
Melarra's not your concern anymore. You need to focus on Doctor Lorrick.
Anything interesting?
Major Byzal will contact you once you touch down on Kaon.
Good. You're here. We've gathered more intel on the rakghoul outbreak. Things are getting worse.
The Tion noble family has quarantined all worlds in the sector--no ships can land or leave without permission.
It's an extreme measure that's not too popular, especially with the people on the infected worlds. They think they've been abandoned.
The ruling families are turning their backs on their own people.
They're right.
They're scared. Desperate. Things have spiraled way beyond their control.
A quarantine seems like the only way to stop the virus from spreading.
The nobles had no choice.
Maybe, though I think it's too little, too late.
I was hoping we'd be able to stop this before any serious damage was done.
This is worse than I feared.
No such luck.
Four worlds have already been wiped out. A fifth, Kaon, is down to a handful of survivors battling for their lives.
The Republic offered aid. It took a while, but the ruling families finally granted us permission to land on Kaon to help quell the outbreak.
I thought they'd jump at the offer of help.
Why'd they wait?
Doesn't seem like the right time to play hard to get.
What took them so long?
The Tion nobility were afraid to appear helpless. They're having enough trouble maintaining order as it is.
Their hesitation is understandable. They didn't want to give the impression they had lost control.
They didn't want to look weak.
Too bad their political games cost lives.
Anyone could be infected. So when they say "quell the outbreak," they mean "kill everything that moves," right?
A total purge is a good idea.
No! They're actually hoping we can end this with minimal civilian casualties.
My first priority is getting the people trapped on Kaon somewhere safe.
We need to help the survivors.
Several of the survivors are related to the Tion ruling family. That's probably the only reason they let us get involved.
If we contain this outbreak, it will go a long way to establishing an alliance between the Republic and the Tion Hegemony.
People are dying down there. This isn't about politics!
Is that all you care about?
Everything is about politics. Odds are this outbreak wasn't accidental.
Any new details on the plague?
I wish we knew more, but we don't even know how this started.
Clearly someone wants to destabilize the sector. Probably a bid by a rival family to seize power.
We need to find out... before the plague spreads to the Republic Core Worlds.
You planning on sending anyone else on this mission?
Reinforcements would help.
We need to limit Republic exposure to the virus. But you've dealt with the rakghouls before.
Seems like the best way to keep the virus from spreading is to wipe out Kaon from orbit.
Just bomb the planet.
That won't tell us how the outbreak started, and it won't win us any points with the royal family.
That won't happen.
We better hurry.
There's a shuttle to take you down to the surface. Major Byzal, head of Kaon security, will contact you when you land.
Help the survivors if you can. But your first priority is to find out how the virus is being spread.
